content:
ignal sequence is cut off.
For many proteins the ER is just a way station on their travels to their fi-
nal destinations (Figure 20.3). Proteins which will end up in a lysosome are
enzymatically  “tagged”  with  a  carbohydrate  residue  called  mannose-6-
phosphate while still in the ER. An area of the ER membrane then begins to
concentrate several proteins; one protein, clathrin, forms a sort of geodesic
dome called a coated vesicle which buds off from the ER. In the dome there
is also a recep
